The surprisal (bit) is a useful feature to detect whether a word could be core to a sentence and, therefore, most likely to influence its processing cost. In general, words that are more a part of the sentence are word-level features that co-occur with specific types of words in sentences and that can be used to categorize sentences. The surprisal (bit) of individual words, or even small groups of words, then, could be incorporated to predict the impact of individual items on sentence processing cost.

<pre><code>1. Remove duplicates: Add 2 to each token ID to eliminate duplicates in the list.
